content.description: Good sharp pockets on a steep wall. Start as low as possible right under de first bolt (more fun) or take the ramp on the left to reach the bolt (easier). Trend left as you go up.
content.location: Up the gully behind the big catsclaw on a West facing wall. GPS: 35.202118, -114.116907.

content.description: Huge overhanging crack that is actually not as hard as it looks thanks to strategically placed pockets. The bottom is full of loose rock and you will swing in the catsclaw if you blow the move – you have been warned! There is still some loose rock up high and the belayer should stand far from the wall.The top anchors can be a little spicy to access, consider slinging a boulder or anchoring yourself to the Wild Child anchor with a second rope if you are not comfortable with the terrain.
content.location: Left overhanging crack behind a big patch of catsclaw, right of Wild Child.

content.description: Some wild moves to get established, awkward transitions between face and crack climbing, and very joyful mix of fingers, hands, and offwidth crack sizes. Some loose blocks are still present, don't pull, jam the crack behind them! The belayer should stand far from the potential rock fall zone.The top anchors can be a little spicy to access, consider slinging a boulder or anchoring yourself to the Wild Child anchor with a second rope if you are not comfortable with the terrain.
content.location: First very obvious overhanging crack from the right side of the wall.

content.description: Handful of short routes in the Cerbat Foothills Recreation Area.
